component.text:
Standard Troubleshooting Practice
Step 1 – Eliminate a client device as problem source
Step 2 – Confirm the physical status of WLAN devices
Step 3 – Inspect wired links

WLAN Troubleshooting Practice
Step 4 – Confirm access point radio function and update Access
Point drivers and firmware
Step 5 – Check RF interference and channel settings
Step 6 – Check WLAN security mode and encryption settings

Step 4 – Confirm access point radio function and update Access Point
drivers and firmware.

• Check power from PoE module – Radio may be inoperable if power is insufficient
  • Check access point transmit power settings
  • Attempt a connection with another access point
  • Consider radio drivers, firmware, or replacement
